definition: long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain

sentences.english: You sigh, toss and turn, and try to get to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 你長吁短嘆，翻來覆去，試圖能夠入睡。

sentences.english: Suddenly he heard a rustle in the peony pavilion and someone sighing deeply.
sentences.chinese: 他忽聞有人在牡丹亭畔長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: Feeling it break, with bleeding groans they pine.
sentences.chinese: 在痛苦中長吁短嘆，日益憔悴。

sentences.english: You got me chasin' rabbits, pickin' out rings and Howlin' At The Moon.
sentences.chinese: 是你讓我心煩意亂，費心選戒，對着月亮長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: You got me chasin' Rabbits, spittin' out teeth and Howlin' At The Moon.
sentences.chinese: 是你讓我心煩意亂，咬碎鋼牙，對着月亮長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: You got me chasin' rabbits, walkin' on my hands and howlin' at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 是你讓我心煩意亂，手足無措，對着月亮長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: Suddenly he heard a rustle in the peony pavilion and some sighing deeply.
sentences.chinese: 忽聞有人在牡丹亭畔，長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: He also dwelt on the failure of Spring Moon to give her a grandson.
sentences.chinese: 他還對春月未能給她生個孫子而常常長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: He tossed about in bed, moaning and groaning from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 他長吁短嘆，對自己的過失懊悔不已。
